Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add functional test for search title sorting" (#8218) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The functional test that checks that titles can be sorted started failing. This feature is actually unused so we removed the functional test.

Example query: https://azuresearch-usnc.nuget.org/search/query?q=&prerelease=False&testData=true&ignoreFilter=False&CountOnly=False&sortBy=title-desc
Example build: https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=73962&view=results

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Fix flaky db2catalog unit test" (#8217) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The test [`RunInternal_WithMultipleDeletedPackagesWithSamePackageIdentity_PutsEachPackageInSeparateCommit`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/dd26676619c5901c9924fc9b3286ba263c41a446/tests/NgTests/Db2CatalogTests.cs#L533) is flaky.

Example builds that have failed:

* https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=4090330
* https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=4090974

Example builds that have passed (notice there are no changes between failed and passed builds):

* https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=4090487

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Feedback button should not appear if script is blocked" (#7784) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Browser extensions like uBlock Origin block some "tracking" scripts. This can effect the loading of the Usabilla JavaScript snippet. In such a case, the feedback button should not appear.

Today, if the Usabilla script is blocked the button still appears (because we have a custom button) but does nothing when we click it. This is confusing.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][Keyboard]Focus is going to Feedback instead of staying on the same button "Edit"  after cancelling the edit of the package" (#8183) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1184485
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450)


## Repro Steps:

    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "API Keys" and Press enter
    Tab till "Manage drop down" and press enter
    Tab till Edit button and press enter
    Tab till "Cancel" button and press enter
    Tab again
    Check whether focus is going to "Regenerate" button or not.

## Actual Results:

Focus is going to Feedback instead of staying on the same button "Edit"  after cancelling the edit of the package

   
## Expected Results:
The focus should stay on the same 'Edit' button after cancelling the edit option and it should go to "Regenerate" if we press tab button  
## User Impact:
Users with motor disabilities may find it difficult to navigate if the focus order doesn't retrieve correctly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Use client's latest certificate generation abstractions" (#8216) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The client team introduced a [`TestCertificateGenerator`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/0e5413751caebf168e7d363c88b9c22a3560fe60/test/TestUtilities/Test.Utility/Signing/TestCertificateGenerator.cs#L10) abstraction to create certificates for integration testing purposes. This replaces Bouncy Castle's `X509CertificateGenerator` and provides high-level helpers for common tasks (expire a certificate, make it a code signing certificate, etc...).

See this comment for more information: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/pull/916/files#r492732746

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Accessibility: Color-Contrast too low on package page" (#7847) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
I played around with [Accessibility Insights](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and tried it on NuGet.org. The site seems (at least from the "Fast pass") quite good regarding accessibility, but the color on the package page for the currently released package is too low.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. On this URL 'https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/'
2. Perform this operation 'FastPass with https://accessibilityinsights.io/'
3. See error

### Expected behavior
"Congratulations!
No failed automated checks were found."

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/756703/74595115-19d7f800-503e-11ea-8730-fb319a456680.png)

### Additional context
The link color and the background color (this blue-ish color) are problematic. I'm not sure if this combination is used on other pages as well. I would guess that the best fix would be to change the background color of the "bg-info" class. 

I could try to find a color combination, but I guess there is not "right" or "wrong", but if you would like that I should try something just give me a comment here. :)

Events.RelatedBody:
The package https://www.nuget.org/packages/Rido.CoreAppLauncher/0.0.1-Beta1 is signed with author and repo certificates.

NuGet.exe  5.4.0.6315 reports the package as valid
```
Successfully verified package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1'.
```
<details>
Verifying Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1
C:\Users\rido\Downloads\rido.coreapplauncher.0.0.1-beta1.nupkg

Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
Timestamp: 11/7/2018 8:31:32 PM

Verifying author primary signature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Timestamp Responder, O=DigiCert, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 400191475C98891DEBA104AF47091B5EB6D4CBCB
  SHA256 hash: FC834D5BFFDE31DBA5B79BF95F573F7953BCBF9156E8525163E828EB92EA8A93

Timestamp: 11/7/2018 8:36:43 PM

  Subject Name: CN=Symantec SHA256 TimeStamping Signer - G2, OU=Symantec Trust Network, O=Symantec Corporation, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 625AEC3AE4EDA1D169C4EE909E85B3BBC61076D3

When trying to install the same package in Ubuntu 20 (WSL2) with `dotnet 5.0.100-preview.8.20417.9` I got the following error

```
error: Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature found a chain building issue: Revoked: certificate revoked
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Use [AppliesToProject] on IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider implementations" (#10044) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Visual Studio has recently [added `[AppliesToProject]`](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/271500) support for `IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider` providers, which can be used to prevent unneeded dlls. NuGet should use this for all their implementations to avoid unneeded loads of this dll in projects/solutions where it is not applicable, for example:

``` C#
    [Export(typeof(IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider))]
    [Name(nameof(PackageReferenceAttachedCollectionSourceProvider))]
    [Order(Before = HierarchyItemsProviderNames.Contains)]
    [AppliesToProject("DependenciesTree")] 
```

This is required to fix this [performance gate that was broken](https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1136214) that got an exception for 16.7.

**Note:** Similar to UI contexts for commands/packages this only controls whether your implementation is loaded for a given solution. You will still be called back for projects that do not contain these capabilities and you will need to continue to handle this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Ensure legacy PackageReference projects, that trigger a restore through IVsSolutionRestoreService, participate in the solution load restore batching " (#10064) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Improve TargetsForTfmSpecificContentInPackage for TargetFramework alias support" (#10063) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Before .NET 5, customers could extend pack to include additional files by adding their own targets that run as part of `TargetsForTfmSpecificContentInPackage `. For example:

```xml
<PropertyGroup>
  <TargetsForTfmSpecificContentInPackage>$(TargetsForTfmSpecificContentInPackage);IncludeReferencedProjectInPackage</TargetsForTfmSpecificContentInPackage>
</PropertyGroup>
<Target Name="IncludeReferencedProjectInPackage" Condition="'$(IncludeBuildOutput)' != 'false'">
  <ItemGroup>
    <TfmSpecificPackageFile Include="$(OutputPath)\ReferencedLib.dll" PackagePath="lib/$(TargetFramework)" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Target>
```

However, given that the `lib` folder name no longer matches the default `TargetFramework` value for TFMs such as `net5.0-windows`, we need to consider improving this extensibility, so that customers have a property they can use to place files in the correctly named TFM folder.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add telemetry for NuGet's VS extensibility API faults" (#10062) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet's [VS extensibility APIs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/visual-studio-extensibility/nuget-api-in-visual-studio) usually should not throw exceptions. Currently, we have no visibility when they do throw, and require customers to report problems to us.

This is particularly an issue for the new [brokered services](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Contracts/NuGetServices.cs), because all exceptions get deserialized as a single exception type, and the stack trace is lost, so customers are unable to report detailed failures to us.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "restore hangs if you define a source to network folder that doesnt exist" (#9635) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Steps to reproduce:

1. wipe your local cache
2. define a Nuget.Config in root of solution with a source to a network share \\machine\nonexistenfolder
3. run dotnet restore, nuget restore, visual studio

expected: nuget should warn that the feed is not avaible
current: visual studio hanges, nuget hangets, donet hangs

annoying :(
